identificationModule.briefTitle: Gait Control of Stroke Patients Using Visual Feedback

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study is to determine the possibility of gait pattern change via visual feedback among patients with stroke. Also, the optimal visual feedback would be chosen from this study.

armGroups.label: Visual feedback distortion
armGroups.description: Visual distortion increment based on the gait pattern
interventionNames: Device: Visual distortion increment based on the gait pattern

interventions.name: Visual distortion increment based on the gait pattern

primaryOutcomes.description:
Step length symmetry during treadmill gait. When the participants walk on the treadmill, the walk symmetry was calculated from the sensor attached to them.

During the whole period of treadmill gait, step length asymmetry will be recorded.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Participants will be followed for the duration of treadmill gait, an expected average of 15 minutes

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Hemiplegic stroke patients \>= 18 years old
* Functional Ambulation Category \>=3
* Cognitively intact enough to follow the study protocol
* Adults without any gait problem

Exclusion Criteria:

* Quadriplegic stroke patients
* Orthopedic problems to affect gait
* Underlying other neurological or psychological disorders
* Spasticity or contracture which impede the gait.
* Uncontrolled medical problems
* Pregnant.
